title: Taxonomy Classifier Transformations
description: Describes how to turn one set of taxonomy classifiers into another.  STATUS: still filling out.

transforms.title: Taxonomy Transformation List
transforms.description: Collection of taxonomy transformations.  If required, additional transforms should live in adjacent documents.

Transform.title: Taxonomy Transformation
Transform.description: Transformation operation for a taxonomy classifier set.

TransformInput.title: Transform Input
TransformInput.$comment: This should probably use a 'oneOf' conditional on the 'matchType', but that introduces conditional schema, which makes automated construction difficult in some languages.

matchType.title: Matching Operation
matchType.description: The kind of matching operation encapsulated by this item. 'and', 'or', and 'not' use the 'sub' property to define the sub-inputs.  'one-of', 'all-of', and 'includes' use the 'classifier' to indicate the name of the classifier matched, and 'values' for the list of items to compare.

sub.title: Child Matchers
sub.description: A collection of matchers following the rules of the matchType.  This applies only to matchType of 'and', 'or', and 'not'.  'not' values should contain exactly 1 entry.

classifier.title: Classifier Name
classifier.description: Name of the classifier to match against.  Does not apply to the 'and', 'or', and 'not' match types.

classifierPattern.title: Classifier Name Pattern
classifierPattern.description: Regular expression pattern for matching the classifier name.  Follows the same general rules as 'classifier'.

values.title: Matching Classifier Values
values.description: Values that, if matched, trigger the output.

items.title: Matching Classifier Value
items.description: One of the values to cause the trigger to match.

valuePatterns.title: Matching Classifier Value Patterns
valuePatterns.description: Value regular expressions that, if matched, trigger the output.

items.title: Matching Classifier Value Pattern
items.description: One of the values to cause the trigger to match.

Id.title: Unique Identifier
Id.description: Unique identifying string for the item.  These should be ASCII alpha-numeric + simple separators.

DocumentSources.title: Document Sources
DocumentSources.description: Sources that contained the original definitions.  A tool collected those descriptions into this document.

SourceLocation.title: Source Location
SourceLocation.description: Pointer to the location of the source.  Due to the prevalence of this object, property names use a truncated form to shrink file sizes.

rep.title: Repository Category
rep.description: General repository category containing the source.  This might be 'git' if stored in a Git repository, or 'aws-s3', if stored in an Amazon S3 key store, or 'intranet' if stored in an Intranet source.  The different programs may have their own requirements for this value.  It does not define a location within the repository, though.

loc.title: Source Resource
loc.description: The resource identifier within the 'repo'.  Depending on the repo type, this most likely has a required format for that repository.

ver.title: Version
ver.description: An identifier to reference the unique version of the source, as dictated by the repository type.  This might a commit id, or document revision, or a date-time stamp.  The repository type may not have the ability to retrieve this version (someone may have deleted it, or the repository does not support versioning).

a.title: Anchor
a.description: A location within the source.  This depends upon the source type; it might be an HTML anchor tag, or a paragraph title, or a function name, or a line number, or an opcode index.
